member.summary: Only return file system directories.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_DONTGOBELOWDOMAIN
member.summary: Do not include network folders below the domain level in the dialog box's tree view control.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_STATUSTEXT
member.summary: Include a status area in the dialog box. The callback function can set the status text by sending messages to the dialog box. This flag is not supported when BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE is specified

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_RETURNFSANCESTORS
member.summary: Only return file system ancestors. An ancestor is a subfolder that is beneath the root folder in the namespace hierarchy. If the user selects an ancestor of the root folder that is not part of the file system, the OK button is grayed

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_EDITBOX
member.summary: Include an edit control in the browse dialog box that allows the user to type the name of an item.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_VALIDATE
member.summary: If the user types an invalid name into the edit box, the browse dialog box calls the application's BrowseCallbackProc with the BFFM_VALIDATEFAILED message. This flag is ignored if BIF_EDITBOX is not specified.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE
member.summary: Use the new user interface. Setting this flag provides the user with a larger dialog box that can be resized. The dialog box has several new capabilities, including: drag-and-drop capability within the dialog box, reordering, shortcut menus, new folders, delete, and other shortcut menu commands.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEURLS
member.summary: The browse dialog box can display URLs. The BIF_USENEWUI and BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEFILES flags must also be set. If any of these three flags are not set, the browser dialog box rejects URLs.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_USENEWUI
member.summary: Use the new user interface, including an edit box. This flag is equivalent to BIF_EDITBOX | BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_UAHINT
member.summary: hen combined with BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE, adds a usage hint to the dialog box, in place of the edit box. BIF_EDITBOX overrides this flag.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_NONEWFOLDERBUTTON
member.summary: Do not include the New Folder button in the browse dialog box.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_NOTRANSLATETARGETS
member.summary: When the selected item is a shortcut, return the PIDL of the shortcut itself rather than its target.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_BROWSEFORCOMPUTER
member.summary: Only return computers. If the user selects anything other than a computer, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_BROWSEFORPRINTER
member.summary: Only allow the selection of printers. If the user selects anything other than a printer, the OK button is grayed

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEFILES
member.summary: The browse dialog box displays files as well as folders.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: The browse dialog box can display shareable resources on remote systems.

member.name: F:DismGuiPE.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlags.BIF_BROWSEFILEJUNCTIONS
member.summary: Allow folder junctions such as a library or a compressed file with a .zip file name extension to be browsed.
